intro: Hieracium mallopodoides, commonly known as the hairy hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and along roadsides, preferring well-drained soils. It features upright stems with rough, hairy leaves and produces yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. Hieracium mallopodoides is often found in disturbed habitats and can be invasive in some regions.
